intro: Fraxinus nigra subsp. caroliniana, commonly known as the Carolina ash, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, ovate leaves that turn yellow in the fall. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by winged samaras as its fruit. It typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters and has a rounded or irregular crown. This subspecies is often found in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in forested areas.
